question:
What is the output of the following code? 
greeting = "Hi"
name = "Jess"
print("{greeting} {name}".format(greeting = greeting, name = name))

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: The {greeting} replacement field comes before the {name} and the order of the replacement fields are preserved. What is the formatted output?
greeting and name are named replacement fields that will be substituted with string values in variables greeting and name, respectively. What is the output of replacement field substitutions?
The greeting variable with value "Hi" is substituted for the greeting replacement field. The same is also done for the name replacement field and the name variable. The output is "Hi Jess".

detailedSolution: The greeting variable with value "Hi" is substituted for the greeting replacement field. The same is also done for the name replacement field and the name variable. The output is "Hi Jess".
